### Blog

Latest from the blog



```{r}
#| label: setup callback
#| echo: false
#| message: false


library(curl)

# Fetch webpage content
url <- "https://wedata.ch/blog"
webpage <- curl_fetch_memory(url)

# Convert raw content to character
html_content <- rawToChar(webpage$content)

pattern <- 'href="\\./blog/([^/]+)/index\\.html"'
#take the 1th link 
link <- regmatches(html_content, gregexpr(pattern, html_content, perl=TRUE))

link <- unique(link[[1]])[1]

link <- gsub('href="', '', link)

link <- gsub('"', '', link)

link <- paste0("https://wedata.ch/", link)



#content
pattern <- '<h3 class="no-anchor listing-title">\n<a [^>]*>([^<]+)</a>\n</h3>'

#take the 2th link (which is thee second latest blog post)
content <- regmatches(html_content, gregexpr(pattern, html_content, perl=TRUE))[[1]][1]

content <- stringr::str_match(content, "<h3 class=\"no-anchor listing-title\">\\n<a [^>]*>([^<]+)</a>\\n</h3>")[,2]


content <- gsub('<h3 class=\"no-anchor listing-title\">\n<a href=\"./', '', content)

content <- gsub('\n</h3>', '', content)



# date
pattern <- '<div class="listing-date">([^<]+)</div>'
#take the 2th link (which is the second latest blog post)
date <- regmatches(html_content, gregexpr(pattern, html_content, perl=TRUE))[[1]][1]

date <- gsub('<div class=\"listing-date\">\n', '', date)

date <- gsub('\\n</div>', '', date)





```
